Okay, seriously, this is probably my favorite game of all time. When you download it, there are a few maps and a million props and all the Half-Life 2 stuff (weapons, NPCs, models). However, upon opening the 'Addons' page, there are a million more things that you can download, absolutely free! Guns, maps, characters, cars, and even airplanes. This game literally lets you do anything you want, wherever you want, whenever you want. If you thought that Minecraft was the 'ultimate sandbox game', just wait until you try this. It makes Minecraft (and for that matter, most other sandbox games) look puny and wimpy in comparison. Go buy it. Now.

what can i say? Well firstly you can't not like garrysmod! There is something in it for everyone, wether you want to play a racing game or an FPS, you can in garrysmod there is always a way. Or maybe you enjoy the gamemodes like Prop Hunt or Trouble in Terrorist Town. Or maybe you just want to build your own. In garrysmod anything is possible. There is nothing to not like, amazing job developers. The game runs smooth the graphics are good and the gameplay is fun no matter what your into so read this review then just hurry up and buy the freaking game. Best £14 pounds i ever spent. My only problems have been while on sandbox or sometimes online getting chucked back to my desktop and garrysmod crashing for no reason. But i think the main problem is if you want the game to actually work online, you need Counter Strike Source. This though is not the developers fault. When people made the gamemodes such as Prop Hunt or TTT they made them using mainly CSS textures and models so if your getting this game, buy it with Counter strike source for that bit extra.

Where to start.... I clocked up 80 hours of gameplay in the first week of ownership. If you have a job you go to everyday, don't buy this game. You will not be able to get off of the computer in time to go to work. You will not be able to get up to go to the bathroom. You will not be able to eat. You will not be able to drink. That aside, if you play Minecraft, you could compare this to Minecraft's Creative Mode. There are multiplayer servers comparable to Survival Mode, but for that experience, try Garry Newman's other hit,  Rust . If you ever get bored building anything you could ever dream of, the game uses  Half-Life 2 's award-winning combat mechanic, and there is no shortage of DLC for army-building, weapons, and battlefields. There's more than 50 gamemodes in Multiplayer, and you can eat potato crisps.

I absolutley think Garry's Mod is a wonderful game! It has a wide variety of gamemodes, addons (mods), and duplications. Origianlly going to be a mod for Half Life 2, it became a entirely different game instead, but yet still having player models from Half Life 2, weapons, NPCs, props, and vehicles. This game is like a mix of all games due to the gamemodes like Sandbox, Terror in Terrorist Town, Prop Hunt, Murder, Role Play (RP), DayZ, etc. Aside from the gamemodes, it has a large variety of addons (mods) whether it being vehicles, maps, NPCs, weapons, etc. This is where duplication comes in; you can use the duplication tool for making a clone of something you made and like very much, and saves it. Then you'd be able to respawn it in a different map or server (if they allow it). This is a big thing about the game; if a item says 'ERROR' (like a big red floating 'ERROR'), you need to download the addon for that thing, exit out of the game, restart it, and it'll be there. But be careful, you could choose the wrong addon or it would just simply not work. Another big thing with the game is the 'missing textures' which looks like pink and black checkers board. To get rid of these things, you're going to need to buy Counter Strike: Global Offense and Source, and it automatically fixes the textures. Aside of these things in the game, there are the players of the community. There are several types of people: Hackers, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s, Squeekers, Friendly Nutural, Nutural, Spammer, and those who obey the rules that are given (The Nice Guy/Gal). I'd say that more than half of the community is filled with Spammers, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s, Squeekers, and Hackers. The rest are the Friendly Nutural, Nutural, and the Nice Guy/Gal. A tip is if you see someone violating rules of a server, hacking, or anything that they're not supposed to do, report them to a server admin immediatley or even the owner; it works best that way. Anyways I hope this helped the people that want this game or have it! Happy Gmodding! :D

This game is definetely a must have for people who play games on PC. It has really fun gamemodes like TTT and prophunt (although they are now ruined because of crybabies who whine because you killed them, and bad server rules and staff that ruin the game modes) and is definetely worth playing if you can set up your own server with your own rules.  The community of this game sucks though, as I've said before there are crybabies and in gamemodes like TTT they ruin the game because they will just complain about getting randomly killed (Even if you are 99% sure they were a T and could even say why you were 99% sure) and has ruined the gamemode completely (and those cry babies will also get you banned from the server, and are also a large piece of the bad part of the community) but I guess that's what happens when at least 50% if not more of this games community is raging squeakers and immature teens who lie 24/7. You want a lightsaber? Ok you can get it. You want weapons from say COD:MW2, they are available for download.  Another bad thing about this game is that it feels and seems to be unprofessional, a mod, and not a full built entire game. Like for example sometimes when I turn it off, it will still say it is running in steam and I will have to restart my computer in order to play any other games because it says GMod is running even though it isnt.  Overall I'd highly reccomend this game, it's fun, has a lot of replayability and is cheap. It might have a bad community overall and some of the gamemodes like TTT and Prop hunt may be seeing the end of their glory days and the beginning of their death (If it's not already here, which I think it is) . This game is an overall sandbox game. You can do anything from a zombie invasion to creating a plane. You can also play with friends and create scenes together. If you don't enjoy that then you can play on some of the adventure maps, or possibly the horror maps that people post onto the workshop.   This game is very fun and very entertaining. I'd say the only downside is the servers. Sure they're fun once you spend three hours downloading the add-ons, but after that it's mostly a bunch of trolls. Then again, I didn't spend much time on the servers so I may be wrong.   Another thing about this game is that you can find content from almost any game on the workshop. You want Elder Scrolls? They've got it. You want Smash Bros? Yup, they have that too.   Of course you're going to find some slightly inappropriate things, but that's easy to avoid. Just don't look it up.   This game is pretty fun. I like to play it with my friends and we enjoy coming up with mini games to play inside of it. Like I said, the possibilities are endless. So stop reading this and buy the game. 8/10

Some might say that sandbox games need to have a large, open world for you to mess around in. Some might say that sandbox games also need a specific concept or theme. Garry's Mod proves all of those wrong. This is by far my favourite sandbox game of all time, and it defies all of those generalisations listed before. It is so much fun to just mess around with the stuff the game gives you, but it really starts to get fun when you add addons to the mix. In fact it can get quite nuts with addons. Honestly how does one review garry's mod?  All I can say is, if you're not having fun, you're not looking hard enough.  This is a game where you define your own fun.  You want to make a turn-based, singleplayer, strategy setup? Go ahead. You want to play as the secret weapon for the rebel side of a rebels vs overlords conflict? Entirely possible. You want to play as the bad guy in the conflict above? even more possible, with some AI mods. You want to play as the third party enemy? Heck, you can play as a third party one-man army if you want. You want to troll trouble in terrorist town? Go ahead, just make sure noone sees you throwing those smoke bombs or incendiaries. You want to create a walking mech out of wires and props? You are only limited by your own dedication and determination. You want to roleplay? well, there's no shortage of roleplayers or roleplay servers. Want to make a train? There's tools for that too. Don't feel like spending the limited time you have on this planet on the above? well, you're in luck; other people have already done it for you. And it's freely available online. Have something you want the world to see? Contribute it. The world probably wants to see it too, and if it doesn't, no loss; just try again.  I don't know what garry's mod was supposed to be when it started. I don't pretend to know why or how it's related to CounterStrike. I don't pretend to know whether or not the developers truly wanted their game to turn out like this, or are satisfied with it's current state.  I'm just some guy who messes around in singleplayer. I have a blast doing it too. Am I wrong for having fun the way I want to? If so, then I will proudly admit that I have been playing this game wrong since the day I installed it.

At face value, Garry's mod is a quirky, hilarious and seriously addictive Source Engine based physics/sandbox game which allows you to make anything out of, well, anything; as well as letting you play many hundreds of different gamemodes- my personal favourite being the classic 'Trouble in Terrorist Town' mode which sees a group of 'terrorists' being split into a group of 'innocents' and 'traitors' in some sort of murder mystery/cluedo arrangement, with the innocents furiously trying to identify (and kill) the traitors before they themselves end up six foot below and peppered with gunshot. A very fun and challenging gamemode which really lets you see the worst in people; well worth the £5.99 paid for the game on it's own.  However, this description really doesn't do the game, with its many addons, gamemodes and mods, justice; just buy it and try it out for yourself.  Seriously, stop reading this and buy it. This is a game for the creative and innovative.  The kind of people who can pick up a game and play it by figuring out stuff without checking a wiki, like an Atari console. This is not just a game, however. It can be used as a sandbox, build and pose ragdolls and props, screenshot it and share it with friends over Steam.  This game has two sides, the game side and the tool side. Garry's Mod has brought entertainment to many fanbases with the workshop integration for people to upload models of all kinds, and the models from  garrysmod.org  still working, the tool side is used for rendering screenshots or stop motion animation, Dr. Face is pretty good at this.  The game side, is a whole different game, go into role playing and hunting props, or running from a death trap, the workshop has several cool gamemodes, for every kind of person!  Enjoy the game, children. *closes book*

Uh Not too sure what to write here so heres a recipe for Pancakes instead  Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour 3 tablespoons sugar 1 tablespoon baking powder 1/4 teaspoon salt 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg 2 large eggs, at room temperature 1 1/4 cups milk, at room temperature 1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more as needed  Now to make it 1. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg. 2. In another bowl, beat the eggs and then whisk in the milk and vanilla. 3. Melt the butter in a large cast iron skillet or griddle over medium heat. 4. Whisk the butter into the milk mixture. Add the wet ingredients to the flour mixture, and whisk until a thick batter is just formed 5. Keeping the skillet at medium heat, ladle about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet, to make a pancake. Make 1 or 2 more pancakes, taking care to keep them evenly spaced apart. Cook, until bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, and the undersides are golden brown, about 2 minutes. Flip with a spatula and cook about 1 minute more on the second side. Serve immediately or transfer to a platter and cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining batter, adding more butter to the skillet as needed. 6. Procedure for adding fruit to pancakes: Once the bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, scatter the surface with sliced or diced fruit, or chocolate chips, nuts, etc. Flip with a spatula and cook for 1 minute more, being careful not to burn toppings.

Garrys Mod is a physics sandbox based game. But the game dosent have any predefined aims or goals but to only use your imagination. You are enabled to spawn objects and weld them together to create your own contraptions. This game also enables you to play with other people on 'servers'. I found that although that playing the game is well constructed, that there were alot of glitches and when i joined a new server that most of the customized objects created by people where in this strange purple material, which then made me think that my computer was broken but to only find that i didnt have the right 'textures' for that server.  Garrys Mod comes with 29 ingame acheviement and allows you to be able to enable spawning objects from different games but clicking the controller on the main menu. Then it came up with a dropdown list off all the games that garrys mod can implement spawing in the items from those games.  This game is deffinatly a great game to play but has a few issuse so im giving this game a 7 out of 10.

Perhaps the most social game I've ever known, Garry's Mod has not been an average game for me. I've met so many people. Though it's brough times of laughter and dispair, I can conclude that this mod, through allowing so many different ways to play being unlocked, has made me meet some of the most interesting, fun, and kind people ever. It may sound sappy, but Garry's Mod has changed my life and the gaming community as a whole. I intend to play it for years to come.

What is there to say about Garry's Mod that hasn't been said before?, nothing, absoloutely nothing, this game is so amazing that everyone who has ever played it has used all the good words in the dictionary to review it.  All the mods, all the playermodels and addon tools (Model Manipulator, Standing Pose tool, etc.)  hell, you dont even need addons and mods to have a brilliant time!, the stuff already included has billions of possibilities!, Also, everyone from EVERY fandom ever has mods for garrys mod, Bronies, Sonic Fans, Whovians, Sherlock fans, Anime fans, horror movie fans, The list could go on and on, to put it mildly, every fandom you can think of ... there IS a mod that has something to do with that fandom  also, SO MANY USER MADE GAMEMODES!, from the always fun Prop Hunt to the cinematic experience that you can have from your computer desk, there are so many fantastic gamemodes that add to the GMOD experience!  so, what's my verdict?, well, look at the over 200 hours I have spent on this fantastic game, that should tell you enough  If you love wacky, random sandbox-y fun. then this is definitely the game for you ... also, it's like 2 dollars when on a steam sale .. so, yeah ....

With that all said, however, the ability for the community to create custom game modes has resulted in a lot of interesting, fun and somewhat unique multiplayer experiences, which include Trouble in Terrorist Town, Jailbreak, Dark RP, just to name some of the more popular ones.

i have poured over 1400 hours into this game so i think its about damn time i make a good review  pros:  -fantstic, community made game modes such as prop hunt, darkrp and horror story  -open source given that this game has thousands of mods  -fantastic mods that range from weapons to graphics mods and maps  -amazing community and sub communities for large game modes like gmod tower  -the game itself is basically a mod originally for half life and now is its own game which is still a mod for half life and you can also put more mods into it and possibly make a whole new game that has its own mods and mods you can add onto the mod, thats alot of mods  -the only limit is your computer storage and ram  -given that there are mods you can also port things from other games as mods into gmod  -you can make animations out of it  -it's basically a multi purpose vidya   cons:  -there is still no venom snake player model   conclusion:  this game will last you a LONG time with its pretty much endless fun and retardation and room for creativity and the amazing community that keeps this game running like a refurbished previously broken steam engine (see what i did there) this game is a god among games   i give it a CREAMED/10 would and will always play again

A truely unique physics sandbox game which is definitely worth it's price. Although the game description may not show much, there is much more you can do such as enhancing the general sandbox experience or trying out different gamemodes (such as Hide n Seek, TTT, Cinema, and others) if you get bored of sandbox! Things can also get a bit crazy, even more crazy if you have friends to play with! - Pros:    Tons of mods (like gamemodes, props, various tools, entities, etc) on the workshop to explore!    Valve games such as TF2, Counter Strike, and Half-life have props and textures you can utilize in general sandbox or content creation to have even more stuff to create with!    Great with friends (or making friends!)    Created stuff is able to be saved.    Worth the price.    Great gift to a friend.    Generally a great time waster and you can never really get bored, unless you are excessively playing and start dying from starvation, thirst, and proper sleep which obviously nobody cares about. :P  BUT OF COURSE OF EVERY GAME, there are some flaws, but these really don't disrupt the game experience.    Too much mods will make the game no longer playable, especially if you run on a poor computer. Just remember to limit your downloading of mods because if it becomes overwhelmingly huge, you will die trying to clean it out and reinstalling wont work since the add-ons are synced to steam.    Sometimes you will see vulgar content on the workshop, specifically scenes involving ponies, nude models, sexual positions, and generally suggestive content which can be easily be avoided by not giving them your attention and reporting them. But of course, it's always a thing, especially in a sandbox game with no 'predefined aims or goals.'    Suggestive servers/general trolls/the bad side of the Garry's Mod community. Remember, just don't go to the dark side and everything will be fine! Stick with the official servers or play with friends. But if you are curious, go ahead and knock yourself out. Just prepare for the deathly cringes and the 'nopenopenopelolwhatamidoinghere.'  - SO IN SHORT: A very great game as many say it is and worth the 9.99 from your wallet. There are some cons, but they could be generally avoided with common sense! So what are you waiting for, ARE YOU GONNA BUY IT?  (yes im aware a gmod review from me was long overdue with my over 1,000+ hours.)

Brilliant mod, not even a game, that has it STRONG pros and MINOR cons.  Gameplay: It's a sandbox. This game used to be a fun and creative experience where people could create movies and contraptions with friends and strangers. It had a growing community, many fun gamesmodes like minigames, deathrun, fretta, darkrp and sandbox. But then the growing community of casual and friendly gamers turned into a growing tumor of shitkids and autism. Youtubers like pewdiepie, yogscast and markiplier started playing this game, 8 years olds and obnoxious teenagers found the game and started the invasion, stupid and repetitive gamesmodes like prophunt, ttt and jailbreak gained popularity, making many servers change their gamemodes to gain players. The few sandbox servers that are left are now full off male genitals and dupes from the workshop, darkrp servers were ruined by autistic teenagers who are more emotional than the average landwhale on tumblr, and 30 year old basement dwelling admins who can't run servers for ♥♥♥♥, some servers even charge REAL money to give other players certain ingame items. And please don't get me started on the ponies, furries and five night at ♥♥♥♥bear.  This game is the perfect example of how cancerous the 'let's play' youtube community really is. The game is still fun to play with friends but don't expect much from online servers, I wouldn't recommend even checking them out.

EDIT: I'm still going to keep this here.  So paid mods have been removed -for now- HOWEVER if they return in the future I have no doubt Garry will attempt to have them added to here, so I am going to caution people against that.  Also the community here is one of the most obnoxious I've ever seen in the gaming community so don't expect much out of that either.  --V Original Review V--  Looks to be heading in the Paid Mods direction of which I want no part of, mods MAKE this game.   Typical of that scumbag Garry to try capitalize on this too, avoid the publisher Facepunch at all costs.  I somehow doubt his cute little company would survive the backlash if this happens, unlike Bethesda this isn't a massive 'AAA' title company.

An honest review coming from someone who has over 3k hours of gameplay and has been playing gmod since gmod 11.  Garry's Mod was one a fun game where you could do anything and meet lots of new people, hell I met my best friend on gmod.   Now, the game has a ♥♥♥♥ tier community that's full of pathetic 16 year olds and angry, horny, premature FNAF Undertale 12 year olds that are ban happy.   Workshop incorporation only slowed the game down even more, recent updates are causing everyone to crash with the error 'failed to lock vertex buffer' or 'CMDL error: out of memory'.  The game is so miserably optimised, no multi core support leaves even the best computer struggling to push over 30 frames in multiplayer sandbox.  The workshop is full of mostly useless dupes and FNAF garabge. Servers are crawling with ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ kids. Garry spends all of his time on Rust now so updates are few and far between and always break the game in a new way. Full of trolls and hackers. Everyone in the community has some sort of sob story to bring to the table and make you feel like ♥♥♥♥ and that they're life is more relevant and important than yours.  Seriously, for a group of buds, this game is a lot of fun despite being poorly optomised. My buddy and I still play and managed to have fun by taking advatange of the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ community.   If you're getting this to mess around with yourself, you'll get bored of it within a month.

While I do enjoy playing this game, there is just one HUGE complaint that I have about it.  EVERY UPDATE THAT GETS PUSHED OUT OF THE DEVELOPERS (butt) BREAKS THE MAJORITY OF NON-SANDBOX SERVERS. I am a somewhat active member of a community with multiple Garry's Mod servers. Whenever there would be a new update to the game, most servers would have to update, so that they are running the same version of the game. I get that. But, in most cases that I've seen, it just destroys the gamemode that the server runs. So far this year, every single update has ruined TTT in some way or another, usually something in the tab menu. In Hide and Seek, when the seeker is supposed to be blinded, they can see very clearly, but their console is flooding with errors. With the new murder on most(if not all) servers is so buggy that it literally took me over 37 stabs into a person(as in blood came out of them and went onto a wall) with a knife before anyone actually died. When I started playing GMod, I almost never had errors in my console. Now when I play I cant go ten minutes without some form of error. 'You will never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy.'   Gmod...oooh Gmod...  Let me just say it you'll never find a worse commnity other than just mayyybe call of duty, but that might even be a better one.  The game it'self however, is very interesting in many regards and with work and good players would be amazing to play.  The community is just a bunch of people ranging in age from 6-17 largely, it's very very difficult to play. Espically when most admins are underage.  Pros Good game engine for modifications such as making game modes, and so on and servers. Constructive, game modes are abundant. Many many modifications available on the workshop.  Cons As stated, horrible community, you'll have to find a server with 'filters' for idiots. Very few good servers, and it's difficult to find the said good ones. The owner of Gmod is kind of a....ungentlemen as well. But don't worry most of the money goes to VALVe as it's their engine not his.  Now, suppose you wanna start a server? Find out how to, learn codeing as if your server is 'default' it usually won't get players. Make Filters. What are filters? well, they're much like filters for keeping water flow pure, and also like firewalls keeping viruses out, Filters can work many ways to keep 'minges' out, they will keep minges from joining by a variety of methods. First is registering, such as saying 'in order to play you must register and a email must be verified' or what have you. This being complex often wards away younger and dumber people and such, there's also other methods I can't name them all, but another is tracking hours. If someone has more than 500 hours into gmod, or more than 2 thousand into overall games than odds are more towards them being reasonable players, there's other methods such as also having two servers.  One serving as the filter. This will be a public server for anyone to join, admins observe and meet players here and if they deem them 'worthy' they may let them into the second server where they are allowed into the server.  Finally the best one available but not yet used, Training. Players spawn in a training area when first connecting, admins/staff meet them and talk with them seeing to it they're 'pure' players and not going to grief and so on they then will let them run around for one hour but privately monitor them for grief of some kind if it occurs they are banned instantly.   There are other methods I could mention and come up with, over all Gmod could be good but there are few good servers in the server listing, or as I call the server browser 'the sea of dumb' due to all the 'crap' servers listed.    Over all, don't buy unless you know what your going to do and know some servers that you know for certain are good.

I've never known a game that has that, does MInecraft do it? NO, does UNturned do it? G-Mod doesn't have all that much too offer; it got very repetitive after playing for about an hour on Singleplayer as all you can do is play around with the tool gun and create NPCs and Props.   Then when you go on Multiplayer, all the servers that you find have all these strange rules that would take the fun out of the game anyway; such as not being allowed to spawn vehicles, and most of the servers take really long time to load as a lot of them use custom assets off the workshop which take a very long time to download.  This game also needs you have a lot of other games on Steam to use other game's assets, so if you don't happen to own any of the games on the set list of games that are compatible with G-Mod, you won't have much to play around with on Singleplayer.  Though this game does have a good and diverse workshop that I like to download from from time to time, I still think this game was a waste of my money and I do not recommend it.

Garry's mod is a unique kind of game. You will enjoy this a lot and invest all the time you can spend on this game; your grades will drop because you will be too focused on what to do on Garry's Mod and such. This is a great game to socialise with - to make friends, to meet new people - and to actually broaden your perspective about a few things. I learned how basic space ships work, how to build them, how to set up planes, how to fly and drive decently with various vehicles (which in turn helped me get a better understanding of flying/driving in other much harder games). I used to be a kid who wrote with bad grammar and in some indirect way this game helped me master the English language; due to serious roleplaying I also learned how to be creative, how to write a backstory and perhaps even a small book. It also taught me to dislike Russian people (but I suppose cs:go helped me with that).    Why do I rate this game as a negative one?   Because it ruins the way how you look and play other games. [Review Revised: 12/22/2015] [Earlier Review: 8/26/2014] Note: I simply laid everything out this way just so it looks neater. Note: Please excuse the fact that I have a bunch of unnecessary things that I can't rate considering how this game is developed, I will be adding this sort of system to all of my future reviews, so... if things like that occur again then it just means the game has nothing in that area to rate or review.  {---Comment/Opinion---} When I got the game I had fun for the rough 3 hours I put into the game, but then the random content began to become repetitive and old so the game became boring. I tried to resort to additional mods which did allow me to enjoy the game for the full amount of 3 hours until I decided I wanted to try and build with the in-game mechanics, which unfortunately that system was an utter disaster, I then searched up that you need Lua (and possible additional external programs) to build maps and what not, similar to L4D2, however for L4D2 it was understandable because that wasn't the core idea or concept of L4D2, whereas for Garry's mod it was supposed to be. I say Minecraft is better than Garry's mod, however nowadays people believe that Minecraft is crap. I think Minecraft is better at least for the fact that the in-game building mechanics work appropiately and I can actually be creative with the mods and items I have at hand. The default Minecraft is old, however through mods, making my own texture pack, and making my own skins I improved my experience with it. Simply put Garry's mod failed at executing a good in-game building system, yet they more than likely built a nice external building system. Let me also point out that Minecraft was unfortunately ruined due to it's popularity and seems childish or old now to so many people.  {---Things I like about Garry's Mod---} Simply the fact that it was amusing for about 3 hours.  {---Issues I have with Garry's Mod---} Well I practically covered this up above(which was just supposed to be a summarization), anyhow the game interested me with having a lot to offer, a nice in-game building system with countless mods to add to keep the game interesting so I could continue building, and be able to make unique maps and structures anyway I like, however this was all ruined when I dived into the game, after about 3 hours of horsing around and having fun, I lost interest realizing that there was no working in-game creation system, but instead that you had to use an external program to build maps. I'm like, 'You got to be kidding me...', a sandbox game shouldn't be like this at all, unless you add more features to keep the player entertained, allowing the player to choose to work with the system or not as an alternative option only if they want to be that creative. Anyhow, in short I was expecting one thing and got slapped in the face with something I hated.  {---The Rating---} [Mean: 3/10 or 2 Stars = Not Recommended] Note: If the rating goes below 5/10 or 3 stars then I don't recommend it, if it ends up being 5 or 6/10 or 3 or 3.5 stars then depending on the content at hand dictates whether or not I recommend it or don't recommend it, and finally if the rating is above 6/10 or 3.5 stars then I recommend it. This is due to how the ratings below will have to be high to allow the mean to come out as a 7 or higher.  {---Game Concept---} [3] The game concept is simply a sandbox game, which can be quite boring depending on what the sandbox game has to offer, this sandbox game managed to entertain me for about 3 hours, so that's something at least, but I was mainly looking forward to the building system, which of course has to lead to an external program, now I have no problem with this fact, but it's a sandbox game, you don't just do that sort of thing, anyhow I rate the concept a 3/10 or 2 Stars.  {---Game Environment---} [N/A] You can't really rate the environment for a sandbox game since you build the environment.  {---Game Quality---} [5] It's not bad, but it's not really good either. 5/10 or 3 Stars. Also, please note since the game was released on December the 24th, 2004, I believe the graphics could have been better. Of course this excludes anything mod related.  {---Background Story---} [N/A] Again, there was no story.  {---Story---} [N/A] There was no story, considering it's a sandbox game, which is understandable.  {---Plot/Story Progression---} [N/A] There is no story so no story progression or plot can be laid out.  {---Characters---} [N/A] There is no character development or characters in general really, again because of no story, and because your 'Avatar' or 'Character' is just something that just 'exists' so you can enjoy the game.  {---Music Quality---} [1] There wasn't really any music at all, the idea is that games should have music, I sometimes fail to see why, but it sometimes can really bring a game to life when the music is good, like for touching Anime games or shows, however having good music in general is always nice to have and not all games succeed in this area.  {---Conclusion---} [3] (My Rating simply is the mean of the available content above.) In conclusion, I do dislike this game, I can also understand or at least piece together how others enjoy and continue to play this game, but it just isn't my thing. Like I said, I was expecting an in-game building system not external building system.

It's much better with friends, and the best way to play this is to gather some friends and all play on a LAN server, in the same room, though after a while, shooting your friend in the face with crossbow will annoy the both of you. Also, there is a complete lack of tutorials, though youtube can take care of that for you. Overall, don't get this game if you want a lasting experience, but if you want do mess around with your mates for a night, you should get it.

Sadly, I can't reccomend this game. Firstly, I like it. GMod is a fantastic game, you can tell this by my playtime on the game. It is my second most played game. (JC2:MP is just ahead) However, there is one fatal flaw with Garry's Mod, it's players. When the game was first released, and when I first played it in 2012, GMod was a great game. It had some fantastic gamemodes. However, since the game and it's various gamemodes became more popular, and thanks to youtubers such as PewDiePie, the community is now based largely of 7-9 year olds, who don't understand the strategy behind modes such as TTT (Trouble In Terrorist Town) so instead choose to RDM every player they meet. This has ruined the communtiy, and has caused many servers to shut down, as a result of a lack of players. (who were playing the game properly) Also, in response to another reviewer, who stated (I'm paraphrasing) 'GMod is full of 25 year olds who are constantly saying you are RDMing,' I must say, this is because you probably are. Also, this group of people who are around 20-25 are more than likely to be the people who were early adopters of the game (around 14 - 19 when the game came out) and, another point to add to this, GMod is rated 12 by PEGI, so, these 7 - 9 year old players should not even be playing the game. So, in conclusion, Garry's Mod... it's a great game, but, it's community is worse than ♥♥♥♥. I cannot reccomend, unless you plan on setting up your own server, and playing with just your friends, in which case, GMod is a blast!

If you have an older Mac or a weaker computer, don't even think about going online. Even if you have a newer Mac, like my 2013 low-end iMac, use caution when playing.

Honestly an extremely ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game unless you can wait for it to work. This game kicks you straight in the balls as soon as you start playing by making it a requirement to buy Half-life 2 (Both the first and the two episodes) as well as Counterstrike to run any map. You'll begin to find 'User made content' which is the only thing actually holding this game up - albeit barely. Though majority of the time you're going to have to restart the game to use them if they were downloaded mid-game - but don't get me wrong. They are pretty good. What you're going to find with the game itself, is that opening a map is going to take anywhere from 2-30 minutes - though you (The reader, don't get technical with me about this - I'll cut you -) may not experience this. This game is also prone to multiple crashes while playing, this can be anything from a minor annoyance, to a complete game-boner-killer. These crashes are NOT one-off occurances though, they are actually rather common. If you are like... well, any one else, then you'll sit back, maybe twiddle your thumbs for a while, and wait in complete, awe-inspiring boredom as NOTHING happens, all in the vein hope that maybe, 'It's different this time, it won't crash!' though, just like New Vegas, the game is going to laugh as you sit there, like a ♥♥♥♥ing idiot waiting for some miracle that will make your game work.  But hey, that's just MY experience. If you still think that buying this game is a good idea, go ahead and buy it. If not, then I am sorry that you had to hear from me how ♥♥♥♥ this game is.  Yours sincerely, Narasha - The Bane of Games

Oh look, I rewrote this review too! but in all seriousness, this game also deserves a proper review  Now you may be asking 'What the hell is Garry's Mod?' Garry's Mod or GMod started as a mod to Half-Life 2 with GMod 9, and slowly developed to its own game entirely, and you can buy it on Steam now!   Now as much as I like Garry's Mod, I've slowly started to get tired of this game, most servers are full of screaming kids who call you a hacker if you kill them, 50% of the servers are run by nine year olds, and this game is hardly updated.  GMod also (kind of) requires you to buy seperate games to even load most of this game's textures, if you don't even own a Source game, then you will run into missing textures everywhere. (by the way, TF2 does not count, it will load TF2 models and maps, but will still give you missing texture errors) Even if you do own a Source game, it will still won't load certain textures (yes, i own more than one Source game) I've even found myself switching from game to game because of the servers are, like I said, full of little kids.  Well, thanks for reading my review, you've probably downvoted my review since I bashed on your beloved GMod. Like I said, I don't hate this game, I just don't enjoy it as much as when it was actually updated frequently.

This review is based solely on my experiences alone with Gmod. While I have seen youtubers play TTT, Prop Hunt, and more on Gmod, those games have looked really fun.  I've had way too many issues with this game that have caused serious frustration. Looking at the main menu of the game, off the bat, I did not like the layout of Gmod. Everything feels cluttered and looks awkward. It works, but looking at everything in the menu is an eye sore, even more so, going into sandbox mode and looking at the menu screen for items to select is even more of an eye sore. I find myself completely confused on where everything is and how to use it all when in sandbox mode. It's a pain in the butt.  Cosmetic reasons aside, I've had more serious issues with this game.  I've had occasional poor experiences with the online community. I would play a game of whatever, and the players have not been the friendliest.  My biggest issue, however, is the requirement of other games just for Gmod to work properly. I would install a map to play Prop Hunt, and when I play the map, 3D 'Error' objects litter the screen, and many textures are checkered with a pink and black pattern. This means the map has textures or objects that derive from a different game like Counter Strike Source, or Half Life, and basically the only way to get rid of those errors are to buy and install Counter Strike or Half Life if you do not already have them.  The fact that you need separate games to play the actual game modes with ease personally pisses me off quite a bit. Luckily, I have Counter Strike: Source, but a game should not require you to have this or that game just so it can work properly.  Occasionally I'll find that Gmod won't even launch at all, and at that point I don't even know what to do.  Garry's Mod is a cluttered, poorly designed... game? I honestly don't know what to label Gmod as, but regardless, I've had many issues that have left bitter frustration that the end result of playing a fun game may not make up for. I won't lie, I would probably have tons of fun playing Prop Hunt, TTT, Murder, and more, if I could just get Gmod itself to work.  Unfortunately there are just things about Gmod that make no sense and considering how long Gmod has existed, the things I have problems with shouldn't even happen.  I would think that with the popularity of Gmod, it would have had more than enough potential to fix at least half of the issues I've mentioned or improve upon itself, but I have the same issues with Gmod now that I had almost 2 years ago.

So what if you wanted to have fun, build stuff, and just mess around with a whole game engine at your disposal? You'd have single player mode. No, you can't exactly do this with your friends. To do multiplayer, you must subscribe to a poorly managed server that plasters ads to their forums, and offers premium content if you give them money. All those interesting ideas you had and wanted to show people in single player goes down the drain as soon as you hit up someone elses multiplayer. On top of that, you will often run into griefers, kids under twelve, and power tripping admins. The single player is fun though. Host multiplayer yourself if you can, otherwise, stay far away.

While it has great concepts and is the definition of sandbox, Garry's Mod gets boring really quick. You have to have prior knowledge in order to fully use the tools that are given to you, and while there are multiple game modes, content, and servers available for download, most of the people on the servers violate almost every rule/guideline in Steam's policies (foul language, abuse of authority, cyberbullying, discrimination, cheats/hacks, etc.). It has tons of potential, but with there being loads of unpolished content and no fun servers, it is not worth the time or money until improvements are made.

I don't recommend Garry's Mod, but I think it's just that this type of gameplay doesn't appeal to me. For what it is, it's incredibly well done.  I would say that Garry's Mod is a great game-related creativity tool, but not a game itself. There's no story, no objectives, no challenges, and no puzzles.  You can use Garry's Mod create just about anything imaginable. It has the potential to create a nearly unlimited variety of other games, but that potential isn't really fully realized in the community.  Games created by the community are called 'gamemodes' and can be found either on Steam or in the game interface. The best of them are variations on 'Hide and Seek' or arena combat using different environments and weapons. There also seem to be a lot of role-play focused games. These can all be fun, but none of them are the type of game I prefer to play.
It's a great game and all but the community.... it's very bad.

After 500 hours of loving the game, I went back to play it. It was a terrible experience. The game’s community still isn’t as salty as Counter-Strike’s but it was still bad. But there were still some good moments left in this game. Sorry for any bad grammar, I was writing this quickly, truthfully and angerly while watching youtube.  Let’s start with a generic Pro/Con list then I will go more in depth:  Pros. 1. Game with lots of playtime with many gamemodes, players, communities, and servers. 2. Add-ons (Mods) add even more game time to try them and have fun  3. Friends, its excellent steam integration allows to easily play with friends Cons. 1. Salty Community: Not CS Salty but people are really annoying when they are mad 2. Bad Admins: Recently admins became really trash at doing their job 3. Too many/pointless rules: These damn servers and their damn rules man  This game does have tons of content made by great community members. From just Sandbox to TTT, Murder, Prophunt, DarkRP and Hide&Seek there is plenty to do in this game. Each has its own add-ons to create more variety in each server but some are always there and having exactly makes some add-ons super annoying. This game is best with friends, and best on a private server, that way bad admins can’t ruin your day because they are 5 year olds that payed $100 dollars they took without permission from their parents.   Continuing on with the bad admins topic; Admins are plain ret*rded these days. There is no kinder way to say it, they never listen. Someone brakes the rules? They get away. You break the rules? Tough ♥♥♥♥ you’re getting banned. You try to reason with them? “Stop disrespecting me I’m and admin and I am banning you” ~ All Admins Ever.  On my recent replay of Gmod I noticed something else. The admins sided with people who play and donated to their servers. I was on an RP server when a VIP killed me for “being too close to him” the admin checked the log. Even though he shot first and I shot to defend myself he only copy pasted the part where I shot, I then got “warned” (Admin tool that “warns” people too many warns gets a kick/ban) I then said “These admins are terrible” then got banned for disrespect. Sorry they are bad though.  The only admins I ever liked were those on one RP server I used to play on since I was one of the admins. We actually gave people respect and we used the damn log.   The community is just as bad as the admins though; when you accidentally “rdm” it makes sense they get mad they died unfairly. But when you apologize they seem to get madder because its “shoving it in their face”. The human race is doomed if they can’t get over dying in a ♥♥♥♥ing video game.  Also what’s the deal with these rules? In DarkRP some servers have a “Maniac mode” where you get a minute of free rdm but I am roleplaying as a psychopath. I should be able to kill as many as I want anytime. That’s why people RP as the police, to hunt me down to take me out.  In RP you also have to “advert” (announce you are doing something) before doing a lot of things like raiding or mugging. I get its for balance but in real life you don’t yell at your local PD that you are about to mug someone. Roleplay is supposed to simulate real life, not balance it out to give your mortal enemy a fighting chance because they looked in chat.  This game used to be good and fun with less ♥♥♥♥. But in this day and age it’s easier to open up Minecraft or some other non-valve game (because valve games have 100% more salt than other games) and play those instead.

Perhaps I am just stupid, but this has turned out to be the biggest exercise in frustration.... Fortunately, I got it on sale.  Firstly, you will need to watch YouTube or search online to even figure out how to use this. There is NOTHING in game to explain anything. Searching through Steam Community is equally frustrating because 1> half the guides are in languages I don't speak and 2> the search function can't seem to find a forest amongst all trees. And many of the online tutorials assume you know more than you do (the best video I watched for beginners tells you open the spawn menu, but doesn't tell you how to do it until 7 minutes later; The wiki tells you to do it by pressing O in one place and to press Q in another).  So, if you attempt to start this and you default into the flat map, you start out on top of this God-ugly structure. Unless you have figured out how to fly (search online), you have to jump off and you lose 10% health. A sandbox you can die in! And of course, this God-ugly structure is part of the map, so you can't get rid of it. Its in the way and its an eye-sore.  At this point, I attempt to build something, the entire reason I wanted this game in the first place. Place one object. Place a second one that pushes the first one away. Move the first object back, only to have it go flying off across the screen. Begin again. Place one object. Place a second using the controls and mods that were recommended online (again, nothing helpful in-game). Second objects bounces off the first one, hits me and I die. Game over.   Huge Disappointment.

I find it to be very overrated, honestly. I bought the game because I was led to believe that it was full of fun gamemodes and fun people and I was ready to have a great time. Unfortunately, the vast majority of game modes with players completely suck.  Trouble in Terrorist Town is good as long as you manage to find a decent server with proper RDM (Random killing, essentially) rules in place to stop people trolling servers. This is pretty much the only good game mode I found, it also wasnt hard to find a fun server with admins who were nice.  Prop Hunt - Majority of people either are terrible at hiding or try to mimic Vanoss by disguising as a mug and running around. Not an issue in itself but it detracts from the enjoyment of having to find the props when they revel in being chased around.  Murder - Pretty much TTT except for the fact that your name gets hidden and you can't fight back unless you're a detective  Hide n' Seek - Basically Prop Hunt without the Prop part, people tend to actually hide in this one though  RP (SCP RP, Nazi Occupational RP, ZombieRP etc.) -   Basically all the exact same thing with environment changes. Unless you donate or spend a long time on the server you won't be able to play any fun class. For the purposes of this review I'm going to mainly focus on 'SCP - RP Werewolv's Server'. You start being able to either play as a D-Class personnel, where you are able to follow orders and be shot, thats it - a Civilian, where you are allowed to roam the surface and print money (basically AFK, but don't AFK or some fool steals your money) - or a Cook, where you can supply food and microwaves (for some reason) throughout the facility.  To play as a guard, or anything interesting really, requires an absurd amount of time spent either guarding your money printers (you can't fight anyone off by the way) or waiting for a guard to decide to use you as a toy with an SCP player.  Admins will generally be incredibly uptight about any server rules, any slight breach will earn you an airborne trip via Physgun to a rooftop where you will be 'punished' either with a warning or killing you or something. Rules can vary from 'FailRP' which is stuff like holding out your Gravity Gun to 'MingeProp' which is using a prop in a way which is 'not useful' (During my boredom I spawned a fridge and spun it around in the air, causing me to be warned).  To detract from that TERRIBLE server, the DarkRP servers (The most popular game mode) are basically a gritty version of a city, in that the maps look ugly, you still have to donate money to have fun, and if you cook meth (One of the only ways to make money) you can be guarenteed someone will decide to kill you and steal it with guns bought with money they have received from donating.    ------  To conclude, I don't believe that this game holds up to the hype generated in the community in any shape or form. Aside from modes like Prop Hunt, TTT or Murder, your only sources of fun will be abusing donator powers or trying to create your own fun by messing around in an RP server (Escaping the SCP detention area only to be remotely slain by an admin, really fair)  The singleplayer relies completely on you finding your own sources of fun again, this is where the 'The only limit is your imagination' quote is used the most, because theoretically you can do anything with the tools you're provided with. Whether it be building a house, assault course, murdering a group of combine or seeing how many SMG grenades it takes to kill you.  If you have friends who you can reliably install mods and play custom maps with, you will likely have a blast ('Horror' Maps, Private TTT etc.) as it becomes a lot more fun in the company of friends.   I do not recommend this game because the majority of content available - the roleplaying servers - is completely awful and the rest of it - game modes like Go Kart building- are vastly underplayed and therefore you will be very lonely.

Garry's Mod is one of those games I bought because a lot of YouTubers I watch played it. The minigames they played looked fun, and Sandbox looked awesome to mess around with. And after buying it, I'm not as addicted to it as I thought I was. And there are several reasons for that.   First off, Garry's Mod offers a lot to do. You can goof around and create wacky inventions in Sandbox mode, or hop onto a server and play some minigames, like Murder or Trouble in Terrorist Town. You can also change the skin of the character you play as, making it any character from almost any kind of media. You just need to download the model first.   These are some of the main things that drew me into playing Garry's Mod. But after booting it up, I was slightly disappointed. Sandbox mode only looked fun to me out of the enjoyment you can have with friends. But you can only get them on your server if you set up a personal server (which I have yet to figure out how to do) or you have to be in the same building. Plus, going onto servers isn't always the funniest thing to do. They take forever to load and not all of them allow you to mute other players, which, if you're like me, can get really annoying really quickly.  It's overall not a bad game it's just not user-friendly. Most stuff isn't easy to figure out quickly and will take time and effort if you really want to get to the best of what the game has to offer. If you don't mind that, go ahead and buy the game. But otherwise, I wouldn't 100% recommend the game.

For what reason??? Stun stick abuse, Okay but last but not least folks A RDM!!!!! WHAT?!!?!??  The whole point of this review is to say that you should not be surprised if you get a stupid ban by a moderator for much more time than you actually deserve, 9/10 mods will be power hungry sh*ts, and that 15% of the players you see on one of these rp servers will be a troll.
